metadata.title: CVE-2019-9937 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In SQLite 3.27.2, interleaving reads and writes in a single transactionwith an fts5 virtual table will lead to a NULL Pointer Dereference infts5ChunkIterate in sqlite3.c. This is related to ext/fts5/fts5_hash.c andext/fts5/fts5_index.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2').
